intro: Senecio yakla, commonly known as the African marguerite, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces bright yellow flowers with a central disk. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Senecio yakla is also valued for its resilience to drought and its ability to attract pollinators.
